configuration.name: OCU Start Flag
configuration.description: Object Conversion Utility Start Flag

configuration.name: NSCFG - Default NetServer Connection
configuration.description: Used to define NetServer's default connection. This must be configured if the client is using Graphical Admin or any of the NetServer jobs.

configuration.name: File Extension Uploads Restricted for Server
configuration.description: Files with the listed extensions cannot be uploaded to the server.

configuration.name: VMSD Server - TCP/IP Config
configuration.description: Provides the template parameter configuration for AWD view sources. This is only a template, and it should not be modified unless instructed by the AWD Support Center.

configuration.name: Max Selected Items
configuration.description: Max Selected Items

configuration.name: UserID Minimum Length
configuration.description: Minimum # of characters in UserID

configuration.name: Netserver App Loader
configuration.description: This field is set to "awd". This setting should not be changed. This value refers to the loader used by the client as defined in NSCFG_DE_LOADERS_XML.

configuration.name: Language Tags
configuration.description: Includes a list of language tags used to populate the Language list on the Screen Properties tab in the Screen Designer application.

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy User
configuration.description: User name of the proxy for web service calls

configuration.name: Max Work Items
configuration.description: Max Work Items

configuration.name: Special Characters Required
configuration.description: Special characters required in Password

configuration.name: Numeric Characters Required
configuration.description: Numeric characters required in Password

configuration.name: OCU Verification Validator Class
configuration.description: Object Conversion Utility Verification Validator Class

configuration.name: Maintenance Sleep
configuration.description: Setting this parameter to a value greater than zero will enable a maintenance thread that periodically writes JVM memory statistics to the log file. The value is the amount of time in minutes the maintenance thread pauses between writing the statistics.

configuration.name: Multipart Form Data Class
configuration.description: Used to configure the class that handles multipart form data. This parameter should not be changed.

configuration.name: Case Management Use Business Days
configuration.description: Utilize this to setup Case Management to calculate case task due dates by business days.

configuration.name: Minimum Password Length
configuration.description: Minimum # of characters in Password

configuration.name: Data purge configuration
configuration.description: List of data purge configuration

configuration.name: CSRF Checking
configuration.description: Key for cross site request forgery

configuration.name: OCU Start Delay
configuration.description: Object Conversion Utility Start Delay

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy Password
configuration.description: Password of the proxy for web service calls

configuration.name: NSCFG - Platform Encoding
configuration.description: Needs to be configured before running AWD 3.3 on IBM i servers for the first time. It needs to be configured to use EBCDIC encoding.

configuration.name: NSCFG - Content Services
configuration.description: Indicates the content services configuration from the ns.xml file.

configuration.name: NSCFG - VMSD TCP/IP Port
configuration.description: The VMSD TCP/IP listener port.

configuration.name: NSCFG - XML TCP/IP Port
configuration.description: The XML Server TCP/IP listener port.

configuration.name: Active Authentication Filters
configuration.description: Comma separated list of the authentication filters that are active

configuration.name: Home URL
configuration.description: Includes the name of the page to display when the user logs off AWD client.

configuration.name: NSCFG - DE Loaders
configuration.description: Defines the loader used by the client.

configuration.name: Content Management Device
configuration.description: Name of the Content Services device which points to the ContentManagement AFT Server

configuration.name: URL for XF Rendering
configuration.description: URL for XF Rendering

configuration.name: Communication's mail properties
configuration.description: properties used to connect to the SMTP server.

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy Domain
configuration.description: Domain name of the proxy server for web service calls

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy Port
configuration.description: Port of the proxy for web service calls

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy Host
configuration.description: Server name of the proxy for web service calls

configuration.name: Content Management External URL
configuration.description: External URL for Content Server

configuration.name: AFT Address
configuration.description: Address for AFT

configuration.name: Content Management Servlet Tolerance
configuration.description: Time in seconds which a request to the must take place in.

configuration.name: Communications Redirect Tolerance
configuration.description: Time in seconds which a request to the must take place in.

configuration.name: Communications Request Tolerance
configuration.description: Time in seconds which a request to the must take place in.

configuration.name: Communications Servlet Tolerance
configuration.description: Time in seconds which a request to the must take place in.

configuration.name: Default Character Set Encoding
configuration.description: The character set encoding method to use if not otherwise specified. The value should match the encoding method of the database.

configuration.name: Web Service Proxy Exclude List
configuration.description: List of server names for which to bypass the proxy server

configuration.name: Port Range
configuration.description: Indicates the range of TCP/IP port numbers available for use in a cluster.

configuration.name: NSCFG - LOB Alias Mappings
configuration.description: Used to add additional line-of-business (LOB) mappings.

configuration.name: Batch Configuration
configuration.value: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><batchConfiguration><batchJob name="LOGOFFUSER"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.LogOffUser</className><schedule>Y</schedule><interval>3600</interval></batchJob><batchJob name="SUSPENDUSER"><params><param name="InactiveDay">30</param></params><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.SuspendUser</className><startTime>00:25:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="UNLOCKALL"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.UnlockAll</className><startTime>00:45:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="CALCULATEPRIORITY"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.CalculatePriority</className><startTime>01:05:00</startTime><schedule>Y</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="W69PURGE"><params><param name="days">30</param></params><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.W69Purge</className><startTime>01:25:00</startTime><dayOfMonth>1</dayOfMonth><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="QUALITYHOLDOVER"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.QualityHoldover</className><startTime>01:45:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule><daysOfTheWeek>YYYYYYY</daysOfTheWeek></batchJob><batchJob name="GENERICRENDEZVOUS"><params><param name="QueueName1">RENDZ</param></params><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.GenericRendezvous</className><startTime>02:05:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule><daysOfTheWeek>YYYYYYY</daysOfTheWeek></batchJob><batchJob name="QUALITYRENDEZVOUS"><params><param name="QueueName1">QRENDZ</param></params><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.GenericRendezvous</className><startTime>02:10:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule><daysOfTheWeek>YYYYYYY</daysOfTheWeek></batchJob><batchJob name="ACBL0206"><params><param name="deleteDays">30</param></params><className>com.dstawd.legacy.bi.server.ACBL0206</className><startTime>02:25:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="BIMAPPER"><params><param name="sleepSeconds">90</param><param name="ignoreLOBErrors">N</param><param name="batchSize">1000</param><param name="stop">N</param></params><className>com.dstawd.legacy.bi.server.BIMapper</className><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="BIMAPPERDIMENSION"><params><param name="sleepSeconds">90</param><param name="ignoreLOBErrors">N</param><param name="batchSize">1000</param><param name="stop">N</param></params><className>com.dstawd.monitoring.etl.BIMapperDimension</className><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="BIEXTRACTOR"><params><param name="timeInterval">6</param><param name="dateBucket">10</param></params><className>com.dstawd.legacy.bi.server.ejb.impl.BIExtractor</className><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="BIPURGE"><params><param name="mapRetentionDays">90</param><param name="summaryRetentionDays">90</param><param name="endQueue">END</param></params><className>com.dstawd.legacy.bi.server.BIPurge</className><startTime>03:25:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="ADDISABLEUSER"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.ADDisableUser</className><startTime>04:05:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob><batchJob name="ACTIVATESUSPEND"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.ActivateSuspend</className><schedule>Y</schedule><interval>300</interval></batchJob><batchJob name="PROCESSPENDSERVICE"><className>com.dstawd.processing.batch.ejb.bo.impl.ProcessPendService</className><schedule>Y</schedule><interval>90</interval></batchJob><batchJob name="CHECKMAILIN"><params><param name="DateFormat">yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss Z</param></params><className>com.dstawd.capture.batch.CheckMailIn</className><schedule>N</schedule><interval>60</interval></batchJob><batchJob name="TWITTERSEARCH"><params><param name="DateFormat">yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ss Z</param></params><className>com.dstawd.capture.batch.TwitterSearch</className><schedule>N</schedule><interval>60</interval></batchJob><batchJob name="THIRDPARTYFILE"><className>com.dstawd.capture.batch.ThirdPartyFile</className><startTime>04:05:00</startTime><schedule>N</schedule></batchJob></batchConfiguration>
configuration.description: Configuration for batch processes

configuration.name: Service Config Keystore File
configuration.description: Specifies the full path file name for the KeyStore file (.jks) that contains the private certificates used by AWD. This KeyStore file must physically exist on the AWD server at the location specified.

configuration.name: Service Config Keystore Password
configuration.description: Specifies the password for the KeyStore file.

configuration.name: Service Config Authentication Types
configuration.description: Specifies the authentication types available for outbound web services.

configuration.name: AFT Port
configuration.description: Port for AFT

configuration.name: Password Cannot Contain UserID
configuration.description: Password cannot contain UserID

configuration.name: XML Server - TCP/IP Config
configuration.value: <Server><port></port><name>AWD XML Services</name><desc>AWD XML Services</desc><class>com.dstsystems.awd.JobServer.IP.JobServerIP</class><socketBacklog>50</socketBacklog><keepAlive>Y</keepAlive><socketTimeout>7200</socketTimeout><exit><name>AWDJobServerExit</name><desc>Performs Encryption, and job mapping</desc><class>com.dstsystems.awd.JobServer.AWDServer.AWDJobServerExit</class><encryption>Y</encryption><jobMappingResource>/com/dstsystems/config/jobmap.xml</jobMappingResource></exit><authenticator><name>Native Authentication</name><class>com.dstsystems.awd.JobServer.AWDServer.nativeAuthenticator</class></authenticator></Server>
configuration.description: Provides the template parameter configuration for AWD XML services. This is a template only, and it should not be modified unless instructed by the AWD Support Center.

configuration.name: File Extension Uploads Inclusive for Server
configuration.description: Files with the listed extensions are the only ones that can be uploaded to the server.

configuration.name: VMSD Server - Custom Views
configuration.description: The custom views.

configuration.name: NSCFG - Print Server
configuration.description: Insert a <printServer> element with the full path to the BatchPrint directory on the print server machine as the value.
